library(DataComputing)

<!-- put your content after this line -->

```{r}
DailyBirths <- Birthdays %>%
  group_by(date)%>%
  summarize(DailyBirthNumber = sum(births))
ggplot(DailyBirths, aes(x=date,y = DailyBirthNumber))+
  geom_point()
```

```{r}
WeeklyBirths <-
  Birthdays %>%
  mutate(weeks = lubridate::week(date)) %>%
  group_by(weeks)%>%
  summarise(WeeklyBirthNumber = sum(births))
MonthlyBirths<-
  Birthdays %>%
  mutate(months = lubridate::month(date)) %>%
  group_by(months)%>%
  summarise(MonthlyBirthNumber = sum(births))
JulianBirths<-
  Birthdays %>%
  mutate(jdays = lubridate::yday(date)) %>%
  group_by(jdays)%>%
  summarise(JdayBirthNumber = sum(births))
```
#3
```{r}
WdayBirths<-
  Birthdays %>%
  group_by(wday)%>%
  summarise(WdayBirthNumber = sum(births))
```
#4
```{r}
MyTwoYears <-
  Birthdays%>%
  filter(year %in% c(1980,1981))%>%
  group_by(date,wday)%>%
  summarise(TotalDayBirths = sum(births))
  
ggplot(MyTwoYears,aes(x=date,y=TotalDayBirths))+
geom_point(aes(color=wday))
  
```

There are way more births on Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday than on Friday, Saturday Sunday.

#5

```{r}
Holidays <- read.csv("http://tiny.cc/dcf/US-Holidays.csv") %>%
  mutate(date = as.POSIXct(lubridate::dmy(date)))%>%
  filter(year(date) %in% c(1980,1981))
```

#6

```{r}
MyTwoYears <-
  Birthdays%>%
  filter(year %in% c(1980,1981))%>%
  group_by(date,wday)%>%
  summarise(TotalDayBirths = sum(births))
  
ggplot(MyTwoYears,aes(x=date,y=TotalDayBirths))+
geom_point(aes(color=wday))+
  geom_vline(data=Holidays,aes(xintercept=as.numeric(date)))+
  geom_text(data=Holidays,aes(x=date,label=holiday,y=9000),angle = 45)
```
